page.title: 11School Summer Fayre
page.content: On the 13th July 1985 there was a busy atmosphere at the schools. Lots of people came to help with the floats. The fayre began with a carnival procession consisting of four floats, one for the Gala Queen, one for the brownies, one for the playgroup and one for anybody else who wanted to go on it. After going through Mattersey the floats came back to school. As they arrived the Harworth Colliery Welfare Band started playing. After the Gala Queen and attendents had met the Mayor of Retford, the grand opening of the summer fayre started with a speech by the Mayor and the fancy dress competition. Then we had the sideshows and the band played again. At 2.45 pm the school children did some maypole dancing which was followed by a keep fit display by the ladies of Ranskill Keep Fit Club.
